intro: Geonoma skovii, commonly known as the Skov's fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central pool to collect rainwater. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often emerging from the leaf axils. Geonoma skovii plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and moisture retention in its natural environment.
